article: In Twain, many people know what a "motorpool" means. It is  _  known as a place for the maintenance of official business and government cars.  In general  it is a place for vehicle maintenance. More than ten years ago I came to America on business and I took advantage of the  _  to visit my friend. My friend drove a car to  _  me at the airport, and took me to his home. Out of the  _  , my friend drove his car into the innermost  _  , which had a sign "carpool only". I  _  what "carpool" meant. I felt doubted whether he was going to a motorpool.  _  I thought myself clever in asking: "Is there anything wrong with the car?" "Nothing.  _  ?" said he. "Well then, why are you going to carpool?" I  _  . My friend couldn't help  _  and told me that"carpool"refers to the lane that only the cars with two or more  _  can drive in. I felt rather embarrassed on  _  that. After dinner, my friend's neighbor came over to ask whether he  _  "carpool" the next day. "  _  ," my friend said, "I will accompany my friend to go shopping tomorrow." I was  _  again, wondering why he could not "carpool" with him since we had "carpooled"  _  . My friend explained to me again that the "carpool" that his neighbor  _  meant they in turn drove the car to work so as to save energy. The first "carpool" is a noun,  _  the second "carpool" is a verb. It is really  _  for newcomers in America to understand it in a short time.
